medical_history.chief_complaint: High myopia and craniofacial and other skeletal abnormalities.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Myopia was diagnosed at age 13 with eyeglasses prescribed. Over the next 4 years, there was an increase of 12.75 diopters of myopia in the right eye and 11.00 diopters in the left. Eight weeks prior to evaluation, there was worsening of difficulty in eating and chewing after removal of orthodontic braces. Notably, visual acuity was 20/20 with eyeglasses.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient experienced difficulty with articulation in childhood and received speech therapy. He had dental crowding and a class III dentofacial growth pattern noted at age 12, with subsequent orthodontic treatment. The patient had a pectus excavatum present at birth, a stable bilateral epididymal cyst, and previous repair of urethral meatal stenosis. Injuries included an impacted wrist fracture at age 12 and transient musculoskeletal back pain.
medical_history.family_history: The patient's brother has deep asymmetric pectus excavatum and a history of sports-related injuries. The father and multiple paternal relatives have a history of hypertension, the paternal grandfather had coronary artery disease, and the maternal grandmother had non-Hodgkin's lymphoma. The cousin has celiac disease.
medical_history.social_history: The patient lives with parents and a brother, is doing well in school, and has never used tobacco, alcohol, or illicit drugs.
